nodes.name: Ownable

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@return the address of the owner.

nodes.name: updateValueAtNow

balanceOf(address).details: return the reputation amount of a given owner

params._owner: an address of the owner which we want to get his reputation

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Queries the balance of `_owner` at a specific `_blockNumber`

params._blockNumber: The block number when the balance is queried
params._owner: The address from which the balance will be retrieved

params._amount: The quantity of reputation to burn
params._user: The address that will lose the reputation

burn(address,uint256).return: True if the reputation are burned correctly

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

params._user: The address that will be assigned the new reputation

mint(address,uint256).return: True if the reputation are generated correctly

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

totalSupply().details: This function makes it easy to get the total number of reputation

params._blockNumber: The block number when the totalSupply is queried

totalSupplyAt(uint256).return: The total amount of reputation at `_blockNumber`

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

mint(address,uint256).notice: Generates `_amount` reputation that are assigned to `_owner`

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).notice: Total amount of reputation at a specific `_blockNumber`.
